ygData.subject: Re: RE: Anyone on this list?
ygData.msgSnippet: Yes, yes, there still would be rouges, warriors, paladins, and sk s, but think about it.  Sure, you use a bow, but REALLY how many others of those classes do
ygData.messageBody:
Yes, yes, there still would be rouges, warriors, paladins, and sk's, but think about it. Sure, you use a bow, but REALLY how many others of those classes do you know that use a bow enough to pay that much for a bow? I've sold maybe 20 bows throughout my time, and I can only recall 2 occasions I sold to a non-ranger (I'm sure there's more I'm not thinking of, but I say maybe 5 at the most), and they were all hickorys. So, yes, rangers are not 100% of our profits, but they're enough of it that if we lost their business, we'd lose a lot of money.

Slig of Povar

>>> <vagabond@...> 07/19 3:46 PM >>>
From: vagabond@...

> From: "Ben Sarsgard (3)" <bens@...>
>
> I am 100% with you on that one. People complain about us charging to
hit
"combine," but that's not what we charge for. We charge for all the time and
money that was spent to get us to the point where clicking "combine" does
anything. There are also some major economical ramifications of giving away a
trueshot. If this bow could be attained very easily, there would be no market
for ash or oak, as they are inferior bows, yet they would cost way more. 200pp
is a little steep for Povar (they usually go for around 150-175 with no
materials provided), but your server may have less master fletchers.

I disagree with one of your statements: there will be no market. Rangers are
not the only ones that use bows. I know many rogues and warriors that use them
also. I am in-fact one of those rogues. For us, while we drool over the
Trueshot Bow, we can't use it. And that leaves plenty of room for profit.

Of course, I also think that your solution for your friends (where they give you

extra sets of the items) is the one I will be using for everyone when/if I get
to that lvl of ability on fleching....

It all comes down to personal preference. (on my tailor character, I made
patchwork at cost, they give me a pelt and a pattern, I make an item. All
because I was below the break even point on PW at that
time)
